intro.p:
Suppose that a particle moves along a straight line with an acceleration (in m/s^2) given by the function
a(t) = {{acc}}.
Let v(t) and s(t) denote the velocity (in m/s) and position (in m), respectively.

content.p: then compute the velocity function v(t) and the position function s(t).
Find the smallest positive value for t for which the object is "at rest" (aka, has zero velocity). You may round your answers to 2 decimal places. If no such value exists, explain why.
